meanings.definition: In a way that requires a lot of effort and hard work.
meanings.sent1: She worked laboriously on her homework all night.
meanings.sent2: The ant carried the food laboriously back to its nest.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried laboriously to climb the slippery pole.
meanings.sent4: The old car moved laboriously up the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted laboriously, creating a masterpiece with each stroke.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is slow and painstaking.
meanings.sent1: He wrote laboriously, making sure every letter was perfect.
meanings.sent2: The snail moved laboriously across the garden path.
meanings.sent3: The toddler stacked blocks laboriously, one by one.
meanings.sent4: The detective searched laboriously for clues at the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar spun its cocoon laboriously, preparing for transformation.
